episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XIV
episodes.plot: First, Homer kills the Grim Reaper and takes his place in Reaper Madness. Then, Professor Frink's father is revived, only to kill people and steal their organs in Frinkenstein. Finally, Bart and Milhouse get a stop watch that can stop time in Stop the World, I Want To Goof Off.

episodes.title: My Mother the Carjacker
episodes.plot: Homer's mother returns to Springfield, and the city pardons her from the charges against her. Mr Burns is furious about this and makes a plan to get Mona Simpson in prison.

episodes.title: The President Wore Pearls
episodes.plot: Lisa feuds with Principal Skinner after being elected school president.

episodes.title: The Regina Monologues
episodes.plot: Prime minister Tony Blair welcomes the Simpsons to England where they run into author J.K. Rowling and actor Ian McKellen.

episodes.title: The Fat and the Furriest
episodes.plot: At the dump Homer is videotaped while being attacked by a bear. The town regards him a coward, so Homer decides to strike back at the bear.

episodes.title: Today, I Am a Clown
episodes.plot: Krusty decides to do what he never did when he was thirteen years old - have a Bar Mitzvah.

episodes.title: 'Tis the Fifteenth Season
episodes.plot: After spending all his money on an expensive gift for himself, and the family thinking he should be less of an egoist, Homer decides to change his ways.

episodes.title: Marge vs. Singles, Seniors, Childless Couples and Teens and Gays
episodes.plot: A concert for babies ends in a riot, so the childless adults of Springfield gather to make the town less child-friendly.

episodes.title: I, (Annoyed Grunt)-Bot
episodes.plot: Homer pretends to be a robot and competes in Robot Wars to win Bart's affection; Lisa has cat trouble.

episodes.title: Diatribe of a Mad Housewife
episodes.plot: Marge is inspired to write a novel, but the storyline of the book (a fat, mean husband, and a handsome, sweet neighbor) makes Homer jealous.

episodes.title: Margical History Tour
episodes.plot: Marge tells Lisa, Bart and Millhouse three history stories because the library doesn't have any.

episodes.title: Milhouse Doesn't Live Here Anymore
episodes.plot: Milhouse moves to Capitol City, and therefore Lisa and Bart become best friends.

episodes.title: Smart & Smarter
episodes.plot: When Maggie is revealed to have an IQ of 167, Lisa is no longer the genius of the family, causing a rivalry between the sisters.

episodes.title: The Ziff Who Came to Dinner
episodes.plot: Artie Ziff is discovered hiding out in the Simpsons' attic.

episodes.title: Co-Dependent's Day
episodes.plot: Marge takes up heavy drinking to spend more time with Homer. Bart and Lisa confront a famous movie director about the drop in quality his films have taken.

episodes.title: The Wandering Juvie
episodes.plot: After playing a prank on the whole town, Bart is sentenced to six months of juvenile detention. There he meets Gina, who forces Bart to escape with her.

episodes.title: My Big Fat Geek Wedding
episodes.plot: Mrs. Krabapel falls for Comic Book Guy and they plan a Star Trek like wedding. Principal Skinner plans to prevent it.

episodes.title: Catch 'Em If You Can
episodes.plot: Homer and Marge try to have a vacation without the kids but Bart and Lisa follow them everywhere they go.

episodes.title: Simple Simpson
episodes.plot: Homer becomes a costumed vigilante who uses pies for weapons after witnessing Lisa get humiliated at a competition at the state fair.

episodes.title: The Way We Weren't
episodes.plot: Marge and Homer find out that they actually kissed each other at age 10 without knowing they were each other's first kisses, and tell the story about this.

episodes.title: Bart-Mangled Banner
episodes.plot: An accidental photo showing Bart mooning the American flag makes the Simpsons the most hated family in town.

episodes.title: Fraudcast News
episodes.plot: After Mr. Burns is erroneously reported as dead, he buys all of he media outlets in order to prevent them from writing scathing articles about him.
